lines.speaker: HOST
lines.text: I'm {@host} Newsperson with Telimpromptu news.

lines.speaker: COHOST
lines.text: And I'm {@cohost} McNewsman!

lines.speaker: HOST
lines.text: Our leading story tonight {!main_story}. Here's what we know so far: {!main_story_info}

lines.speaker: COHOST
lines.text: Thats right {@host}. We are also being told {!main_story_info2}

prompts.description: The main story of the night!
An additional detail about the main story, which is {!main_story}
Additional info about the main story, {!main_story}. We also know {!main_story_info}.

lines.speaker: HOST
lines.text: Joining us now is our guest expert {@guestexpert} Expertson who has a {!expert-credentials}.

lines.speaker: HOST
lines.text: Thank you for joining us.

lines.speaker: GUESTEXPERT
lines.text: Thank you for having me on {@host}.

lines.speaker: HOST
lines.text: First question, {!expert_question1}?

lines.speaker: GUESTEXPERT
lines.text: {!expert_initial_answer1}, {@host}, {!expert_full_answer1}

lines.speaker: COHOST
lines.text: Remarkable.

lines.speaker: GUESTEXPERT
lines.text: Maybe to some, but when you have a {!expert-credentials} like me, you see this kind of thing every day.

lines.speaker: COHOST
lines.text: Next question, {@guestexpert}, {!expert_question2}?

lines.speaker: GUESTEXPERT
lines.text: {!expert_initial_answer2}, {@cohost}, and here I should add a relevant detail to the case: {!guestexpert_detail}, as I will now demonstrate. (Demonstrates)

lines.speaker: COHOST
lines.text: Final question, {!expert_question3}?

lines.speaker: GUESTEXPERT
lines.text:
I'm sorry {@cohost}, I cant answer that question. When I obtained my {!expert-credentials}, I swore a particular and solemn oath.
That oath is this.
(Places hand on heart)
{!expert_oath}

lines.speaker: HOST
lines.text: Well that was really something. Thank you for your time, {@guestexpert}.

lines.speaker: GUESTEXPERT
lines.text: Thank you.

prompts.description: The credentials that the expert has. Eg: 'PHD in Rocks', 'Bachelors of Astronomy'

subPrompts.description: The start of the answer to the first question that hasnt even been written yet. Eg: 'Yes', 'I can't answer that', 'No'
The start of the answer to the second question that hasnt even been written yet.
First question the host asks to the reporter. The guest expert's answer starts with '{!expert_initial_answer1}'
Second question the host asks to the reporter. The guest expert's answer starts with '{!expert_initial_answer2}'
The answer to {!expert_question1} which starts with {!expert_initial_answer1}
Write a detail for the guest expert to present that they will have to demonstrate themself.

prompts.description: Write the oath that the guest expert who has a {!expert-credentials} had to swear upon entering their field.

lines.speaker: COHOST
lines.text: {@guestexpert} Expertson has agreed to an exclusive interview with Telimpromptu News. He is a distinguished professional and has a {!expert-credentials}. {@guestexpert} Expertson, thank you for joining us.

lines.speaker: GUESTEXPERT
lines.text: It's a pleasure to be here.

lines.speaker: COHOST
lines.text: {@guestexpert}, in your professional opinion, what do you make of this story?

lines.speaker: GUESTEXPERT
lines.text: Well, {!phony_expert_answer1}.

lines.speaker: COHOST
lines.text: (Listening on ear piece) ...I've just received word from our sources that {!cohost_contradiction1}. {@guestexpert}, how do you respond to that?

lines.speaker: GUESTEXPERT
lines.text: Well, ..I uh, (clears throat). It's clear that your 'sources' don't have a {!expert-credentials} like me, or they wouldn't even be asking such questions.

lines.speaker: COHOST
lines.text: (Talking softly into ear piece) Really? I don't believe this. (Talking to guest expert) I've just gotten word that {!cohost_contradiction2}. {@guestexpert}, what do you have to say for yourself?

lines.speaker: GUESTEXPERT
lines.text: Uh....uh...{!guest_expert_plea}.

lines.speaker: COHOST
lines.text: Alright, I'm afraid we'll have to cut our interview short. I'm sorry about that, folks.

prompts.description: The credentials that the expert has. Eg: 'PHD in Rocks', 'Bachelors of Astronomy'
Write an expert account of the story for the guest expert, who claims to have a {!expert-credentials}. Make the guest expert's account completely unbelievable.
Write the information the cohost receives that contradicts the guest expert's claim that {!phony_expert_answer1}.
Write a piece of information that reveals that the guest expert's claim of having a {!expert-credentials} is a lie. E.g. 'The University of Hampburgshire is not a real university'.
The guest expert has been found out to be a phony. Write his desperate plea that reveals his real reason for wanting to get on TV.

lines.speaker: HOST
lines.text: We go now to field reporter {@fieldreporter} Reportsalot. {@fieldreporter} thank you for joining us.

lines.speaker: FIELDREPORTER
lines.text: Thank you, {@host}.

lines.speaker: COHOST
lines.text: Whats going on at the scene of the incident?

lines.speaker: FIELDREPORTER
lines.text: Well, {!fieldreporter_fieldreport1}.

lines.speaker: HOST
lines.text: Anything else?

lines.speaker: FIELDREPORTER
lines.text: Yes, we have a quote from a witness who saw the incident firsthand. Quote, {!fieldreporter_quote}.

lines.speaker: COHOST
lines.text: {!host_exclamation}.

lines.speaker: HOST
lines.text: {!host_exclamation} is right {@cohost}.

lines.speaker: COHOST
lines.text: One last thing, {@fieldreporter}. Do you have a message for the families at home?

lines.speaker: FIELDREPORTER
lines.text: Yes, {!fieldreporter_familyanswer}.

lines.speaker: HOST
lines.text: That's field reporter {@fieldreporter} Reportsalot. {@fieldreporter}, thank you.

lines.speaker: FIELDREPORTER
lines.text: Thank you.

prompts.description: Write 1+ sentences on what the field reporter sees at the scene of the incident.
An exclamation the host says. Eg: 'Wow!' 'Holy moly!'
Write a quote for the field reporter to present on something said by a witness who saw the incident firsthand.
Write a message for the field reporter to give to the families at home.

lines.speaker: HOST
lines.text: Turning back now to the scene of the incident where I’m being told reporters have managed to get a few words with a witness who saw the event.

lines.speaker: WITNESS
COHOST
lines.text: Enlightening.

prompts.description: Write a silly voice for the witness to talk in, it should be a voice that the person reading can do. Ex. 'British', 'Mickey Mouse' The prompt will show up as: '(in a your_text_here voice)'
Write the first half of a witness' firsthand account of the scene in as many words as you like. They will be speaking in a {!witness_voice} voice.
Write the second half half of a firsthand account of the scene in as many words as you like. It starts with: {!witness_account1}

lines.speaker: HOST
lines.text: This just in, I'm getting word that we've managed to get an exclusive interview with Detective {@detective} Gumshoe who is live on the scene. Detective, what can you share with us?

lines.speaker: DETECTIVE
lines.text: Well, the situation is worse than we thought, my team has just discovered that {!detective_info1}.

lines.speaker: HOST
lines.text: Horrific.

lines.speaker: DETECTIVE
lines.text: It gets worse. In all my years as a detective never before have I seen {!detective_info2}.

lines.speaker: HOST
lines.text: Well detective, do you have any clues as to why this happened?

lines.speaker: DETECTIVE
lines.text: Indeed I do. A note was discovered at the scene of the incident, it reads: {!detective_note}.

lines.speaker: HOST
lines.text: Detective, thank you for your time.

prompts.description: Write a discovery for the detective to present. Context: 'Well, the situation is worse than we thought. My team has just discovered that (Your text here).
Write a discovery for the detective to present. Context: 'It gets worse, in all my years as a detective never before have I seen (your text here)
The detective will present a note that was discovered at the scene. Write what the note says.

lines.speaker: HOST
lines.text: Tonight we have a special treat for you all. We have {@zookeeper} the zookeeper here from the {!zoo_name}!

lines.speaker: ZOOKEEPER
lines.text: Thank you for having me on.

lines.speaker: HOST
lines.text: So {@zookeeper}, what do you have for us tonight?

lines.speaker: ZOOKEEPER
lines.text:
I've got my little buddy {!animal_name} with us. They're a little scared but they'll warm up to you pretty quick. Say hi {!animal_name}!

(Make timid a {!animal_type} noise.)

lines.speaker: HOST
lines.text: Oh wow!

lines.speaker: COHOST
lines.text: You know, I have a special affinity for {!animal_type_plural}, once while I was on vacation {!cohost_animal_story}.

lines.speaker: HOST
lines.text:
Haha.... it seems like little {!animal_name} has warmed up to us! Arent you a nice little {!animal_type}

(Zookeeper makes a friendly {!animal_type} noise.)

lines.speaker: ZOOKEEPER
lines.text: You know, {!animal_name} is actually pretty smart for a {!animal_type} and actually has some experience with the topic of tonight's story!

lines.speaker: COHOST
lines.text: Well isnt that something!

lines.speaker: ZOOKEEPER
HOST
lines.text: Well I'll be! A talking {!animal_type} incredible! Thank you for bringing them for us tonight.

lines.speaker: ZOOKEEPER
lines.text:
No problem. Thank you for bringing me on.

(Make an {!animal_type} noise that could maybe be interpreted as goodbye)

prompts.description: The name of a Zoo or somewhere that contains animals.

subPrompts.description: A type of animal the Zookeeper will bring on.

prompts.description: A story the cohost tells where they encountered an {!animal_type} on a vacation.
A story that a {!animal_type} tells in a {!animal_type} accent, relating to tonight's main story.

lines.speaker: HOST
lines.text: On the scene is {!religious_title} {@religiousleader} who practices {!religion_name}! {!religious_title} {@religiousleader}, what are you doing here?

lines.speaker: RELIGIOUSLEADER
lines.text: As the {!religious_title}, I must {!religion_description}. That is why I am here.

lines.speaker: HOST
lines.text: I see. But what are you specifically doing on the scene?

lines.speaker: RELIGIOUSLEADER
lines.text: I am here to {!religion_performance}

lines.speaker: HOST
lines.text: You {!religious_leader_insult}! That will endanger everyone on scene!

lines.speaker: RELIGIOUSLEADER
lines.text: I disagree. Everyone join in.

lines.speaker: RELIGIOUSLEADER
lines.text: (To the tune of {!chant_tune}) {!religious_chant_1}. (Everyone joins in) {!religious_chant_2}-

lines.speaker: HOST
lines.text: (Make a loud interrupting noise). Back to the news.

Make the title for the religious leader who practices {!religion_name}
Describe what a religion named {!religion_name} would practice.

prompts.description: Say something that would make the scene more dangerous.
Create an insult for the leader of a religion named {!religion_name}. They practice {!religion_description}.
Name a song that {@religiousleader} knows. Be as basic as you want.
Create the first half of a chant for a religion named {!religion_name}
Create the second half of a chant for a religion named {!religion_name}. It should be interrupted.

lines.speaker: HOST
lines.text: Well, there you have it folks. A story like this you only see once in a lifetime. {!host_story_description} {@cohost} its an unbelievable story isn't it?

lines.speaker: COHOST
lines.text: Well, it shouldn't be all that surprising given that {!cohost_statistic}.

lines.speaker: HOST
lines.text: Thank you for shedding some light on the facts, {@cohost}. Well folks, that’s all the time we have for tonight. Goodbye.
